column2: ENGLISH
Appease Nature Spirits
By using a small portion of your influence and sacrificing some wealth, you can ask the spirits of the land or the local fey for a boon.
Receive a boon from spirits of nature.
Appease Nature Spirits
A druid of the Emerald Enclave, skilled in matters of learning, joins your court.
A druid of the Enclave joins you.
The ranks of the Emerald Enclave are always brimming with promising druids. Thanks to my rank, I have gained the service of such a person.
Excellent.
You have decided to visit the shrine in the holy grove and make an offer to spirits of the wilds, hoping for their aid in return. What will you ask them for?
A long and healthy life.
I wish for affection and companionship.

column2: Great spirits, I'll give you back land that was taken from you.
You offer the spirits valuable land that was once part of the wilderness.
I bring a great deal of gold to you.
You offer the spirits great riches.
Spirits, may this feast please you!
You offer the spirits the best food and drink money can buy.\n
I had this idol carved in your honor. I hope it will please you.
You offer the spirits a small carving.\n

The land you promised to the spirits was't cheap, but you managed to buy it. No longer shall this place be tormented by the plows of farmers or the axes of woodcutters. Now you can only wait for your just reward.
An heavy chest full of coinage is left at the place of worship. The Ancestors will surely be pleased with such a rich gift. Now all you can do is wait, and hope.

Together with the local druids you placed a great bounty of food and drink on the offering stone. You spent the entire night among satyrs, dryads and other denizens of the wilds, feasting and singing. Now all you can do is wait, and hope.
You placed the delicate little idol on the offering stone and paid your respect to the spirits. Now all you can do is wait, and hope.
May the spirits bestow their blessing upon me.
